title: How to Make Macaroni and Cheese Cups

steps.headline: Spray a  6 cup jumbo muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray.
Fill a large saucepan with water and bring to a boil.
Add the elbow macaroni, reduce heat, and stir to make sure the macaroni does not stick.
Cook the macaroni using package directions.
Add thebutter or margarine to the saucepan.
Melt the butter over low heat.
Add the flour, salt and pepper.
Add the eggs slowly to the milk mixture.
steps.description: Make sure that the eggs are not rotten. Whisk until smooth.

steps.headline: Add the cooked elbow macaroni to the sauce.
Spoon the macaroni mixture into the prepared muffin pan, filling the cups just under 1/2 full.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden.
Remove muffin pan from oven and allow the cups to cool about 10 minutes.
Gently remove the baked Macaroni and Cheese Cups.
Label sandwich bags and then gently insert one Macaroni and Cheese Cup into each bag.
Store the Macaroni and Cheese Cups up to three days in the refrigerator.
steps.description: You can also freeze the cups for up to 3 months, if desired.

text: Preheat your oven to 375 °F (191 °C).  Spray a  6 cup jumbo muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray.  Fill a large saucepan with water and bring to a boil.  Add the elbow macaroni, reduce heat, and stir to make sure the macaroni does not stick.  Cook the macaroni using package directions.  Drain the cooked macaroni.  Add thebutter or margarine to the saucepan.  Melt the butter over low heat.  Add the flour, salt and pepper. Whisk to combine. Whisk in the whole milk.  Add the eggs slowly to the milk mixture. Make sure that the eggs are not rotten. Whisk until smooth. Add the cooked elbow macaroni to the sauce. Gently mix to combine. Spoon the macaroni mixture into the prepared muffin pan, filling the cups just under 1/2 full.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden.  Remove muffin pan from oven and allow the cups to cool about 10 minutes.  Gently remove the baked Macaroni and Cheese Cups.  Label sandwich bags and then gently insert one Macaroni and Cheese Cup into each bag. Seal. Store the Macaroni and Cheese Cups up to three days in the refrigerator. You can also freeze the cups for up to 3 months, if desired. Finished.
